questions.question_text: When using the ServiceNow Client Software Distribution (CSD) product in conjunction with Microsoft System Center Configuration Manager (SCCM) to automatically remove software and reclaim license rights in your environment which of the following is required?

choices.B: You must purchase Orchestration separately in order to revoke software and reclaim license rights using SAM Pro
choices.D: An SCCM configuration record must be created to identify the application and the associated software discovery mode
choices.C: The software to be removed must have been discovered by SCCM
choices.A: The software to be removed must have been installed by SCCM

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D is correct.

Excerpt from SAM on-Demand course: "To utilize the revoke and reclaim capability, an SCCM configuration record must be created that identifies the application, the uninstall collection for the application, and the associated software discovery model. An uninstall collection must be identified to define a lease end date for deployed software, allow lease extensions, and revoke software from a user's machine."

Selected Answer: D
The correct answer is D

questions.question_text: What SAM feature automatically adds the next version and downgrade rights to a software model?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Should be A
As per downgrade rights documentation from ServiceNow - The Software Asset Management content service generates downgrade rights. The downgrade rights correspond to a discovery map. A scheduled job, Download software content: Downgrade Rights triggered on a weekly basis, gets the downgrade rights from the Software Asset Management content service and pushes the data to the Downgrade Rights [samp_dmap_downgrade_model] table.

Selected Answer: A
Same here - would like to change to A

comments.content:
I would like to change my answer to A. Content Service.
https://www.servicenow.com/docs/bundle/xanadu-it-asset-management/page/product/software-asset-management2/concept/downgrade-rights.html

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B is correct answer.
The Software edition feature automatically manages version rights by:
Adding next version rights (upgrade rights)
Adding downgrade rights
These rights are automatically associated with the software model when the edition is configured

Selected Answer: C
Should be C in my view.
Downgrade Rights are associated to entitlements

Selected Answer: AE
should be normal & emergency.

Selected Answer: AE
By the learning script it would be normal and emergency.

questions.question_text: License Change Projection works for which of the following change types? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
A discovery model is partially normalized based on publisher and product fields only. In this case, the version field is editable and once that information is added the normalization status is changed to Manually Normalized. https://www.servicenow.com/docs/bundle/xanadu-it-asset-management/page/product/software-asset-management2/reference/normalization-status.html

choices.E: A discovery model normalized based on product field alone
choices.A: A discovery model was normalized based on publisher product version fields
choices.D: The software discovery model has not yet competed its run through the normalization process
choices.C: A discovery model was normalized based on publisher and product fields only
choices.B: A discovery model was normalized based on publisher field a one

questions.question_text: What is the definition of Partially Normalized?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: CD
CD is the answer

Selected Answer: CD
per named device, per named user should be the answers

Selected Answer: CD
Should be CD

Selected Answer: CD
CD is correct, i think.
